website_summaries.verdict: Many of the pieces can be used throughout the year as part of your LEGO collection.
pros: The calendar is lightweight and takes up little space
We love that you can save the pieces and recreate the city Christmas scene for years to come
Each piece is detailed, but simple enough for kids to build with ease
The set is packed with a wide variety of winter themed vehicles
cons: Be sure to set up in a secure area, as the calendar is easy to knock over

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as I hoped
customer_reviews.text: I decided to make life easier this year so instead of filling a calendar myself, I bought this for my 7 year old son and a playmobile snow scene calendar for my 3 year old daughter. I have to say that although it's ok, it could be a lot better. There are a lot of seemingly random objects...like a lego drone and a very small train. But it just doesn't seem very festive. By contrast, the playmobile one is being played with every morning. It is creating a real setting with pieces that make sense and go together to make a whole playset. The lego one just seems kind of boring. It's still ok...but I expected better.
customer_reviews.author: Lexi NJ

customer_reviews.title: Lego Lovers Love This!
customer_reviews.text: My 6 year old grandson received the 2019 edition for an early Christmas gift. He loves Legos, but didn't have many people or other unique items. He loved this and couldn't wait to open a new door every day to see what new surprise awaited him. He would build the new Lego item while eating breakfast. I spotted this 2018 version and bought it to put away for Christmas 2020. A few items are the same, but there are many new surprises for him to build. It adds to his collection of regular Legos and he loves designing new creations from his imagination.
customer_reviews.author: Shorebird

customer_reviews.title: Next year I'll go back to a stale chocolate advent calendar
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes for this Lego Advent calendar. Usually I get the unfulfilling chocolate kind, but thought this would be a fun little switch. It wasn't fun. With a few exceptions I found the builds to be so random and boring that I lost interest in even putting them together. I mean, how many different ice cream themed builds should you get in a freakin' advent calendar? There seemed be be no rhyme or reason to the builds, and a few of them were so bonkers that I had to google what it was that I was supposed to be building. A HARD pass on this, don't waste your money ... it's no fun.
customer_reviews.author: Kerrie_T

customer_reviews.title: Our favorite advent calendar
customer_reviews.text: Our boys are 18 and 20 now and we still all love the Lego Advent Calendar. We've gotten one every year since they were little. Last year we got the Star Wars one, but this year the Star Wars one didn't look to have anything that set it apart or that was significantly Star Wars, so we went back to the traditional City one. It has never disappointed. Well, that one year there were cops and robbers in it was kind of weird... I can't always find these in stores and I love knowing that if I buy it before December, it's always a good price.
customer_reviews.author: Holly

customer_reviews.title: Great for kids!
customer_reviews.text: 5-year-old loved it! He needed a little help with building some of them. And a couple were hard to figure out for me since there aren’t instructions, just a picture where you can only see one side of the completed LEGO structure. It would be nice if this came with a booklet of the LEGO structures so that after Christmas, you could dispose of the box and still have instructions on how to build everything. Otherwise, you’re left with a ton of little LEGO that you probably don’t remember how to rebuild.
customer_reviews.author: Alicia H.

customer_reviews.title: Santa replaced with someone else
customer_reviews.text: Instead of getting Santa as shown on the flap, we got a lady with a ponytail wearing a red shirt. The whole appeal of this set is the Christmas theme. I went to order replacement parts and the Santa hat is out of stock. My 5 year old son was disappointed. I ordered this in September so too late to return it. Waste of money and not as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: (house plant)

customer_reviews.title: Great idea.  Good job legos.!
customer_reviews.text: My son asked elf for a daily gift if he was good every day before Christmas. This was the perfect gift from elf to ensure that happened. Every morning we would open the door for that day and assemble the pieces into whichever little figure or item it was for that day. It was great playing each day with a new item; Added that little bit of extra fun each time.! Will buy again next year, assuming legos is still his thing.
customer_reviews.author: PeanutNthebeast

customer_reviews.title: Great idea, but needs some work
customer_reviews.text: We bought several of the advent calendars for this season. First, great idea instead of candy. Kids really loved seeing what they can build each day. The Star Wars and Friends ones were very good, but the City was lacking. Couple of items in there was meh at best. I would probably get two Star Wars versions next time. Also, the packaging could be upgraded, some of the parts did move around (the extras would float around the box) because my kids put the completed items back in too keep.
customer_reviews.author: MNPilot

customer_reviews.title: My son was Very disappointed in this product!
customer_reviews.text: My son and I was so excited about this Calendar, He started opening as they should be opened. The first few were little men then just stuff he didn’t even want to play with. He was most happy with Santa. It was super disappointing! I gave it a 2 star rating for the Santa and the snow man. We will try hot wheels this next year! I did watch the reviews and what was supposed to be inside before purchase and it wasn’t as described at all. After a few days opening it he wasn’t even excited anymore. Very disappointed in this product!
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: Bought this Advent calendar for my 9 year old. When it arrived, I allowed him to open up the first door. It was a little spaceship and he has been playing with it the past two days. This little Lego toy, that has maybe 15 pieces total, has given him an interest in space and moon landings. All in all, this product is really nice and will give my kid something to look forward to in December every day of the week!
customer_reviews.author: Trista

customer_reviews.title: No diagram to indicate what the figures are supposed to be...
customer_reviews.text: We are disappointed. Inside each square is a plastic bag filled with LEGO pieces. However, there are no instructions or photos to indicate what figures they are supposed to be when you build it. For example, it would be super helpful if day 1 :snowman, day 2: Santa, day 3: Christmas tree etc... Because we have no idea which figures are included in the set, it is difficult to assemble them. My 5 year old who is a Lego fanatic is frustrated. We heard rave reviews about this. Maybe we are missing something but now I need to find another advent calendar for my son.
customer_reviews.author: Maia

customer_reviews.title: My daughter loved it
customer_reviews.text: It was nice to get this previous year so my kids could have different ones. They loved it so much I will probably do more this year. We had them relate each day to the spirit or Christmas since we are Christian and wanted to relate it to Christ. It was beautiful what the kids came up with each day. Made it nice!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great fun for all kids!
customer_reviews.text: This was a fun gift around Christmas. Great price $20. Some cost around $50 which is too much in my opinion. Easy to assemble the LEGO pieces. Each day flap has a pic on it to see how to assemble. The pieces are contained in little bags behind the flap and all were where they are supposed to be. Kids loved it!
customer_reviews.author: MrsM

customer_reviews.title: Saved the Day !!
customer_reviews.text: It’s really cool each day you get a new tiny LEGO project and some of them are pretty big considering the little windows they are in ! I will be buying one again for Christmas 2019 ! This seller actually saved the day it was the only place I could find one that would get here by December 5th every where else was sold out or wouldn’t receive it until the 15th so Thank You !!! My son loved it
customer_reviews.author: Shannon Marie Lee

customer_reviews.title: Lego lover must have
customer_reviews.text: Yes I bought mine wayyyyy early. I will never be caught without one of these for the holidays. My child started these years ago and fell in love. I love watching him open them and putting them together. At the end of the holiday we put them all on a lego board for a full scene. These are just the best thing for lego lovers.
customer_reviews.author: Tess

customer_reviews.title: Daily Gift!
customer_reviews.text: This was a great idea! My 8 year old absolutely loves this. It honestly has him jump out of bed in the morning before school to build immediately (after finding our Elf on the Shelf). Great little present each day of Advent that all comes together as one nice Xmas scene. The best part is that after its all over, you can just recycle them into your LEGO collection to be used in other creations.
customer_reviews.author: MSA

customer_reviews.title: 2018 City Advent
customer_reviews.text: We’ve had the City Advent every year since they came out. Usually they are amazing. This was the first year that it was a bust. Honestly, we aren’t even sure what some builds are (what are all those ramp things??). We’ll still get the 2019 one, and the weird parts will be used with other legos, but kind of disappointing. The ice cream stand and bakery were cute, though. Also, there was a squeal of excitement for building the drone.
customer_reviews.author: Sara

customer_reviews.title: Cute LEGO Advent Calendar
customer_reviews.text: My kids loved this Christmas advent calendar. As they counted down each day before Christmas, they took turns opening the doors to the bag of pieces. The photos were easy for them to follow. I have a 4 year old and a 7 year old. They had a little bit of a hard time opening up a couple of the perforated doors on the box to get to the pieces, but overall they had fun making the simple pieces. I loved the variety of things they could build each day.
customer_reviews.author: happylady

customer_reviews.title: One of the lamest lego advent calendars that I've seen...
customer_reviews.text: Our family loves the Lego advent calendars but this one is a disappointment. A sled dog wth no assembly, a lamo sled with a snow ramp, a food cart that is misdesigned so the wheels fall off (and don't touch the ground). I had to use some spare parts to fix it. My guess is this a rush job at Lego. We're only at day 16, so hopefully it gets better. How are there already 360 reviews when 9 days haven't even been opened yet?
customer_reviews.author: dane8it

customer_reviews.title: Fun toy, excitement each morning.
customer_reviews.text: I got this Lego advent calendar for my son and I got my daughter a Playmobile one. They are both fun and the kids get excited about them each day. I have to say though, we are all more impressed with the Playmobile set. It just seems more fun, the gifts go together to make a play set. I wish I would have gotten them both a playmobile one. It’s still fun of course, I just wish the Lego set had a better theme.
customer_reviews.author: Beckeroo84

customer_reviews.title: Who doesn't like Lego?
customer_reviews.text: I purchase these every year to count down to Christmas. My kids love these daily Advent legos then by Christmas you have an entire theme, and they play with them all year too. Remember to not open the box. There is a flap that folds out and acts as the base to your advent story, this is where the numbered doors are. (My kids tend to think they should open the box on the sides each time.)
customer_reviews.author: Hopefulforinspiration

customer_reviews.title: Fun advent calendar
customer_reviews.text: My mistake was not buying two of these for two boys. We tried splitting the days and some days the toy was very easy to assemble and other days it was harder. The easy ones were a little disappointing compared to the harder ones. I got this for a 6 & 7 year old and it was easy for them to do. They had a lot of fun throughout the month with this set!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product, great activity
customer_reviews.text: I love LEGO no matter what it is. Because of that my kids love it too. These advent calendars are great as a fast, fun activity to do with my little ones. we started late so got to do 17 in a row and it took less than an hour working with a 3 year old and a 5 year old. The mini models are fun to make and display well on their own or with any other christmas LEGOs one may have.
customer_reviews.author: Dakota Allen

customer_reviews.title: Definitely will do an advent LEGO calendar again
customer_reviews.text: We usually leave a little gift out for our kids everyday of Dec until Christmas. (Snack size candy, party favor toys, etc) This year tired the LEGO Advent Calendar. Our Elf on the Shelf brought it Dec 1. Kids enjoyed it-my 10 year old son the most. But the other kids (6 & 12) liked seeing what it made too. Was much easier then little gifts every morning. Will do again.
customer_reviews.author: jamie

customer_reviews.title: Super fun and totally worth getting!
customer_reviews.text: Our children take turns opening the doors to find a LEGO surprise. Each day from Dec 1 to 24 they get a mini set to build or some sort of minifigure. On the back of the door is a diagram showing how to assemble each little set, but they often try to figure it out themselves. Each set is small but nice. This is really worth getting so we'll be looking next years come November!
customer_reviews.author: TOPJOB7Top Contributor: Lego

customer_reviews.title: Fun concept, too easy of builds
customer_reviews.text: My 5 YO and my 9 YO liked the idea of this very much, but by the third day, my older son was jealous of the trickier builds in the LEGO Friends set his sister had. This was for sure LEGO Jr level. It’s fun to have a Santa and a soccer ball, but most of the pieces weren’t too special. I hope it’s a harder set, but if t isn’t, maybe I will think of a different plan for him!
customer_reviews.author: bld424

customer_reviews.title: Pretty cool, kids will love it
customer_reviews.text: Pretty cool, kids will love it! I wish the boxes kept the insides more of a surprize for the kids though to make it even more exciting. But otherwise, fun calendar
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fun!
customer_reviews.text: This was a super fun way to do an advent calendar last Christmas! My 4 y/o really enjoyed it. It was really neat to see him learn how to read a design; a the beginning of the month we were having to do most of it for him, but by the end he was completely solo! We'll definitely get one next year too!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Lots of tiny pieces but massive amounts of joy! Absolutely worth it!
customer_reviews.text: I and my mother in law bought 4 of these for my children. Everyone of them from my eldest teen to his youngest brother just loved them. Each day was a fun new experience of opening up that days window, building the piece if required and then setting them up to send photos to their grandparents. They want to do this kind of advent calendar again next year but to build more scenes for their pictures that become the daily holiday update to the family.
customer_reviews.author: Kass

customer_reviews.title: Great for older kids who like to create.
customer_reviews.text: Super fun for the family, I saw this back in November and I impulsively got it because it was so cute. Fair warning tho, if you have little little kids this might be difficult, the pieces are so small and some of the items are amazingly complex to put together. Very cute and very fun... a good pre Christmas present for a 12 year old. I have had Advent calendars my whole life and this is a good alternative to give instead of chocolate ones.
customer_reviews.author: Marlene Metzler

customer_reviews.title: Lame
customer_reviews.text: Not as great as I had hoped. My son is LEGO crazy and easy to impress and this was still kind of a dud. If they were overpriced but were fun to play with, fine. But it's basically random tiny LEGO things that are expensive and don't coordinate for play. Wouldn't buy again.
customer_reviews.author: molly

customer_reviews.title: Great gift for a 7 year old
customer_reviews.text: Our son loved this. He's not super into legos, but does play with them occasionally. The idea of getting new surprise everyday was what he really enjoyed. He also liked putting together Christmas themed lego items. They are all very cute. I love that they give extra pieces too. Each one took him less then 5 minutes to put together.
customer_reviews.author: MurfyGirl

customer_reviews.title: 10 year-old daughter loved this
customer_reviews.text: This was a Christmas season gift for my daughter. Simply put, she loved it. It was the first thing she did every morning and she was rarely disappointed. Not every day is as cool as the Santa Claus mini fig, but every day she got pieces that she was able to out to good use.
customer_reviews.author: Tony Davis

customer_reviews.title: Great holiday fun!
customer_reviews.text: We had so much fun putting this together!!! Grandkids were in town, and it was a nice little holiday project... easy enough for them to put together, and get into the holiday spirit!
customer_reviews.author: Holly

customer_reviews.title: Eh....not awesome
customer_reviews.text: We really enjoyed the 2017 set, but the 2018 set fell pretty flat in our home. There were some items that were strange - not related to the holidays, winter or anything that we could quickly identify. My 7 year old was bored after like day 10 or 11. Even now in March we still have about 3 of these that have not been assembled.
customer_reviews.author: Beck

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price
customer_reviews.text: Its like every past year calendar. My son loves it and looks forward to it each day. This year was special as it has a dog. My son loves dogs. He even arranged some small round brown pieces in a pile behind the dog. He thought it was hysterical that the set came with dog poop. Overall worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: name pen

customer_reviews.title: Great advent calendar
customer_reviews.text: My son loved this advent calendar. I was gone for most of the month of December and every night that I got on video chat with him, he would excitedly say I have something to show you! And show me his new toy. It's all small pieces and everyday is a new toy they put together. I will purchase again next year.
customer_reviews.author: savellaa

customer_reviews.title: Grandson looks forward to these every year!
customer_reviews.text: Great way to celebrate a whole month of Christmas! I've been buying these every year for my grandchildren and they look forward to receiving an early gift that counts down the days til Santa comes!
customer_reviews.author: J. Gilbert

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: We are only half way through the calendar, but I love it! My son lights up when he gets to open it and says something like “this is my favorite! How did they know?!?” and “this is the best ever!” We are unable to do a lot for Christmas this year due to moving, but this kind of makes up for it. At least for him.
customer_reviews.author: Anna

customer_reviews.title: Fun countdown to Christmas
customer_reviews.text: My 5 year old son really enjoyed opening a new door every day. One night he said he was too excited to sleep because he couldn’t wait to open the next one. Personally I thought some of the builds were too small and ugly, but my son didn’t seem to mind. We will probably get another one next year.
customer_reviews.author: 1CreativeFlair

customer_reviews.title: 2 thumbs up!
customer_reviews.text: My son who is 10 years old loved this product. He was so excited to receive something each day for the holidays. I definitely recommend this product to any other Lego lover out there.
customer_reviews.author: Janeth

customer_reviews.title: Great for kids with food allergies!
customer_reviews.text: Huge hit for our child that has a severe dairy allergy. He can’t have the chocolate version advent calendar, so he is treated to the LEGO version. I’d say he has no complaints at all. Great for those who have children with a food allergy, or just don’t want the chocolate version
customer_reviews.author: KH

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!!!!
customer_reviews.text: By far one of the best purchases I have made my son absolutely loves it!!!! We take time every night to open one and put it together. Plus the fold out part is like a mini play mat so that’s a nice area to set up the things he gets every night. I would recommend this 10 times over!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Lea

customer_reviews.title: Great set!
customer_reviews.text: We got the city advent calendar with Santa, snowman, etc in it. It did not disappoint - my son had so much fun every morning in December. It even motivated him to get out of bed before school and get ready (ha!) . We will definitely get a new one next year.
customer_reviews.author: Vann Benson

customer_reviews.title: Little hard for younger kids, but we like this.
customer_reviews.text: My grandsons are 8 and 9 years, they are pretty good at the Legos that come with directions- these are harder and it was a challenge- I guess it opens up good "family" time- I had fun working on the projects with the boys when I was around. Love legos and I would probably do this again.
customer_reviews.author: Yaki-D

customer_reviews.title: Great for a 7 year old
customer_reviews.text: Love it! Best part is the nephew doesmt care it was "last year'" advent calendar. Perfect for a 7 year old. Looks forward to every morning when he gets to open the next one
customer_reviews.author: sissy

customer_reviews.title: JUNK
customer_reviews.text: JUNK.... everyday was wrong had to open and go through them only to find out it was missing 2 days. All the days were off and didn’t match. Closing window for return over cause I bought it early..
customer_reviews.author: C. Mortensen

customer_reviews.title: Such a great idea
customer_reviews.text: My son absolutely loves this advent calandar and I love that he isn't eating cheap plastic chocolate. He is so excited to open the doors. 1 tip. You cut the plastic tape on the sides and pull down the "plat mat". I tried peeling the tape and it ripped the core box.
customer_reviews.author: Heather J.

customer_reviews.title: Excitement Everyday
customer_reviews.text: Making this Christmas Holiday extra special! Every morning my son is begging to look before school. His excitement is amazing. My only gripe is the Friends set seems to have more unique pieces, this set has had quite a few smaller, more quickly done items.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Marie

customer_reviews.title: It's a Lego Christmas
customer_reviews.text: It's a tradition to purchase this for Christmas. Some pictures are difficult to follow for the young one. With some help, these Legos are fun to build.
customer_reviews.author: Craig

customer_reviews.title: Exciting way to count down to Christmas
customer_reviews.text: Both my 10 year old girls absolutely loved this Advent Lego set and couldn't wait for their turn to open up the day's surprise. They are still playing with all the new Legos and even have the calendar still up - great purchase, would definitely buy again!
customer_reviews.author: Jo

customer_reviews.title: Always enjoy this Lego set
customer_reviews.text: Have bought these for several years and have never been let down. This one is no exception, we really enjoyed opening and assembling the different models throughout the month of December.
customer_reviews.author: Ace

customer_reviews.title: Great Advent Calendar!
customer_reviews.text: This is our first Lego advent calendar, and my 10 year old loves it! He's excited each morning to see what awesome lego surprise awaits him. The toys are tiny, but great! We are on day 3, and so far he's gotten a spaceship, a figure, and a train.
customer_reviews.author: mamabear

customer_reviews.title: Daily fun!
customer_reviews.text: We get a Lego Advent every year. This one was super fun and my 7yo twins loved it. Lots of fun items to open daily and coordinate once they are all open.
customer_reviews.author: Shari Riebeling

customer_reviews.title: Best advent calendar
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my nephew as an early gift and he loved it. It gave him an activity to work on with his dad for each day instead of getting sugary sweets. It’s an added plus that he was able to add these to his LEGO collection and uses them all the time.
customer_reviews.author: elise cabori

customer_reviews.title: Not that cool
customer_reviews.text: Each item in small and kind of lame. The best things IMO are the people. A lot of what's in there, my son and I are guessing at what they are. Won't be buying again.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley H

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: My kids lived this advent calendar. Fun, easy to assemble daily Lego kits. Tried to talk them into kissing them back in for next year, but they weren't having it.
customer_reviews.author: I shop too much...

customer_reviews.title: LOVE!!
customer_reviews.text: Great advent for your kiddo (or in my case, adult) if they are a lego fanatic!! Plus it’s less candy and more building fun around the holidays!! The directions are pretty simple so smaller kids might need help putting them pieces together.
customer_reviews.author: Verna Seal

customer_reviews.title: Better than cheap chocolate
customer_reviews.text: My daughter is into legos and I thought this would be a fun advent calendar for her. Some of the Lego figures are awesome while others we weren’t so sure what they were or what it had to do with Christmas. All in all she got some new legos and she’s happy.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Kinda disappointed
customer_reviews.text: My son has asked for this for over a year. I’m we were so excited to have this but the pieces were mostly figured and just a few small things like a Xmas tree or ice cream cart. A little disappointed. My son is 7.5 btw.
customer_reviews.author: beanie2kids

customer_reviews.title: Christmas LEGO wonderful set for days
customer_reviews.text: Had the best time every morning at breakfast looking forward to the next LEGO surprise at 3 he was just so happy and to see the joy it was worth every penny
customer_reviews.author: Colleen

customer_reviews.title: Advent is a time of anticipation!
customer_reviews.text: My son is currently a LEGO fiend. He wants everything LEGO this year. This was an excellent find and we hope LEGO makes another next year! Simple sets for him to build himself. Every day is a new day of anticipation, not only for Jesus' coming, but LEGO too.
customer_reviews.author: Rebekah

customer_reviews.title: Great prechristmas gift
customer_reviews.text: Every year I buy this for my children and the first Monday we assemble it. I have four boys so the idea of having to remember whose four day rotation turns me into the grinch. This way it is like a mini Christmas decoration for the month. I put it on the coffee table and it gets played with my kids and children as people stop by to visit through the month.
customer_reviews.author: Catherine Hoskins

customer_reviews.title: Impressive Advent Calendar
customer_reviews.text: I was impressed with this advent calendar. A new toy every day with assembly instructions. My kids loved it. We were also grateful for the extra pieces because they are quite small and easy to lose.
customer_reviews.author: JaimeTop Contributor: Calligraphy

customer_reviews.title: Very cute and will keep kiddos occupied
customer_reviews.text: This lego advent calendar is perfect. My son will love putting them together each day leading up to Christmas.
customer_reviews.author: Staplej

customer_reviews.title: Buy these every year without fail!
customer_reviews.text: Always a hit with the kids. Great items everyday to add to our ever growing lego collection. You could buy 1 extra if you like to put away as the price the following year will likely double for past advents.
customer_reviews.author: Maria

customer_reviews.title: Any Lego lover on your Christmas list?
customer_reviews.text: My grandson loved opening a window every day. As an avid Lego lover, he was so excited with each day's new goodie.
customer_reviews.author: Tammi Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Great item for the money. So fun!
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my 5 year old son this past Christmas and it was a mom win! Our friends and family were blown away by this advent calendar and how you get a little thing every day. Opening his calendar door was the highlight of my son’s day! My son is a LEGO junkie and we loved the items in this calendar and the details were adorable.
customer_reviews.author: Hillary

customer_reviews.title: Cute set!
customer_reviews.text: This is a cute set! I was worried at first that I would have to buy a separate advent calendar box to put them in, but I checked, and under the flap on the box, it has a punch out for each day, so the box itself is the advent calendar.
customer_reviews.author: Kali

customer_reviews.title: Really fun
customer_reviews.text: This has been a blast! It's a nice alternative to candy every day and helps to build the LEGO collection. The pieces inside are fun and not all Christmas themed, so they're easily integrated into other sets.
customer_reviews.author: E.E.B.G.

customer_reviews.title: I wasn't going to get one but every time the see one in the store they say how much they love it. Great price for this many figures
customer_reviews.text: My boys are obsessed with the Lego City Advent Calendar. This is year three. I wasn't going to get one but every time the see one in the store they say how much they love it. Great price for this many figures!
customer_reviews.author: slee

customer_reviews.title: Entertaining Gift
customer_reviews.text: I have bought the Lego Advent calendar products for friends and grandchildren aged five to ten years old for several years. The Advent calendars are well packaged and easy for children these ages to put together. Having a small gift to put together for most of the days in December makes it a meaningful gift for both boys and girls.
customer_reviews.author: Librarian

customer_reviews.title: $10 at Costco
customer_reviews.text: I needed to buy one and the Lego store was out. This is last year’s edition, which is just fine, but way overpriced.
customer_reviews.author: Trackside

customer_reviews.title: Worth the $$
customer_reviews.text: I never got my son this advent calendar because of the price. I decided to splurge this year and I'm glad I did. He is 10 and I loved how excited he would get. Some new and different every day!
customer_reviews.author: L. Hobbs

customer_reviews.title: Great LEGO surprise
customer_reviews.text: Was thrilled to find last year’s still available. Decided this was the perfect year with 9yr old & 7yr old boys for their Elf, Moxie, to surprise them with on his first morning to arrive. Bought this one and the current 2019 so they each have one. They’ve been so excited each morning to see what they have to build.
customer_reviews.author: JenGuy

customer_reviews.title: Worth the purchase
customer_reviews.text: Great way to get the kid to wake up early on a cold winter morning for school. Adorable little pieces especially the Santa which is difficult to get otherwise. Wish the snowman had a face.
customer_reviews.author: S. Haltom

customer_reviews.title: Tradition
customer_reviews.text: Tradition to purchase these and open every day before Christmas. The base makes a good play area and the kids really enjoy building the little sets to make a larger scene at the end.
customer_reviews.author: vickersja

customer_reviews.title: Fun and way better than cheap candy
customer_reviews.text: So much better than a candy calendar! My kiddo got a new Lego every day and couldn’t wait to open it every morning. It was cheaper at Barnes and noble but I love the convenience of online ordering
customer_reviews.author: RainbowRage

customer_reviews.title: A new holiday tradition for our family
customer_reviews.text: This was a perfect tradition for a family to start. Our 4 year old LOVES LEGOs and is always so excited to open the next days LEGO. I loved how each day did something new and how there is ALWAYS spare parts for each days set. I was lucky enough to snag this calendar for $20 but I would say it’s worth the full retail price. I would highly recommend if you have an avid LEGO lover in the family.
customer_reviews.author: Mellissa Ochsner

customer_reviews.title: Practical and fun!
customer_reviews.text: My nephew loves getting a gift each day and we actually use it for an incentive for performance at school. He is excited to have a “good” day and can’t wait to open it ! What a genius idea!
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Wrong Spots
customer_reviews.text: My son was so excited about his LEGO Advent Calendar, however everyday he opened a door, the directions didn't match the toy, so we had to open all the doors, just to find the directions, someone messed that assembly package up.
customer_reviews.author: Carrie Mattila

customer_reviews.title: Fun for all ages
customer_reviews.text: Great for all ages. Bought this for my 14 yr old son, who says he is too cool for it, but he loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Great activity to count down to Christmas
customer_reviews.text: Great activity for my 3 and 6 year old to keep track of the days leading up to Christmas. Each day had a new thing for them to build and play with. We will definitely buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Heidi

customer_reviews.title: Yes! Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Pretty cool. Not to many pieces. My 6 year old loved it. The LEGO FRIENDS o e has loops built in each so you can hang them on a mini tree if you want. My daughter LOVED all of them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Enjoyed.
customer_reviews.text: I almost didn't buy bc of mixed reviews, but my son was very happy with this and I definitely felt like it was worth what I paid. This helped me get him out of bed in the mornings also.
customer_reviews.author: Snd1985

customer_reviews.title: Love it.
customer_reviews.text: Always great. My kids (boy and girl) love this Advent calendar. My daughter was bummed this year that I bought her the Lego friends one and she said next time she wants this one.
customer_reviews.author: razz

customer_reviews.title: LEGO does it again
customer_reviews.text: some mini sets were a little difficult to make for a 4 year old on his own, but its a great idea and my son loved racing down stairs every morning to see what each day was going to be! great idea lego
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Super cute gift
customer_reviews.text: Great price so easy to order and have it delivered to my home.
customer_reviews.author: Noreen DalyMcArdle

customer_reviews.title: the best lego advent calendar by far
customer_reviews.text: even beats the star wars one. i think every single day was a good figure. so rare in pre-made advent calendars. hoping lego comes out with a new one for 2019
customer_reviews.author: Back to the East

customer_reviews.title: A must for kids
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent idea instead of candy all the time .The little pieces for every day are adorable and my daughter wakes up early every day to do the one for that day.
customer_reviews.author: queen bubbles

customer_reviews.title: fun for all
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Wish they had items mixed up... Not the same in every box. I have 2 boys and one of them is opening his backwards so it's more fun. Cool so far though!
customer_reviews.author: Brock5

customer_reviews.title: very disappointing
customer_reviews.text: This lego set was very disappointing and not worth the price. My niece, in her excitement, tore the box open in order to start building. Then she realized that the box was actually the body of the advent calendar. This is definitely not typical lego quality!
customer_reviews.author: frank Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect as always
customer_reviews.text: We buy a calendar every year. One for each of the 3 kids. Some of best memories are opening each day and seeing what you get.
customer_reviews.author: Christa S Badstein

customer_reviews.title: Son loves this
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for the 2018 Christmas year and my 7yr old loved opening it every morning. Look forward to buying the one for 2019 if its different.
customer_reviews.author: TexasGirl

customer_reviews.title: Christmas Lego!🎁
customer_reviews.text: My Grandson hasn’t opened it yet because Advent hasn’t started, we had bought other Advent Lego for him over the years and he really enjoyed them. He has always enjoyed playing with Lego’s.
customer_reviews.author: sue brennan

customer_reviews.title: LOVE!!!
customer_reviews.text: my kids like legos and I wanted to find a cool advent calendar_ these were awesome! Got a Christmas themed boy one and Lego Friends for my daughter. We all loved it
customer_reviews.author: tianna odonnell

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for boys - 10!yrs old!
customer_reviews.text: This LEGO advent calendar was awesome and provided daily entertainment for the entire month! The LEGO toyscare great! 10 yr old boy loved! Was excited about opening every day!
customer_reviews.author: Science Kid

customer_reviews.title: Kids love it and so does Mom and Dad
customer_reviews.text: Every morning the kids are more interested in opening their advent calendar then watching television. Product is small and I feel once the season is done the Legos will just blend in with the other buckeyes of Legos
customer_reviews.author: kris reaser

customer_reviews.title: Christmas Tradition!
customer_reviews.text: I have gotten these for my kids each Christmas for the past few years. The kids love them and I look forward to seeing what they build each day up until Christmas.
customer_reviews.author: Melanie Brazier

customer_reviews.title: Super fun!
customer_reviews.text: Our son loved every thing in this calendar. He loved that it told a story of Christmas morning. We get the LEGO advent calendars every year and love them every year!
customer_reviews.author: S. Bentley

product_meta.title: LEGO City Advent Calendar 60201, New 2018 Edition, Minifigures, Small Building Toys, Christmas Countdown Calendar for Kids (313 Pieces)
product_meta.description: Ring in the holiday season with the fun 60201 LEGO City Advent Calendar. There are 24 different buildable presents, one for each day of the holiday season, including a space shuttle, race car, drone, robot, Christmas tree, monster truck and much more. This LEGO City set includes 5 LEGO minifigures and a dog figure.
feature_bullets: Build 24 different presents, including vehicles, minifigures and seasonal items with this fun advent calendar with toys
This building set includes a husky dog figure and 5 minifigures, including a snowman, robot and Santa Claus
Vehicles include a drone, spaceship toy, race car toy and monster truck
313 pieces – Fun toy for boys and girls aged between 5 and 12 and for fans and kids of all ages

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.8 out of 5 stars1,106 ratings4.8 out of 5 stars
